intro: Nocca helianthifolia, commonly known as the yellow wood sorrel, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant features trifoliate leaves with heart-shaped leaflets and produces small, yellow flowers that resemble those of the true sorrel genus. Its botanical characteristics include a fibrous root system and a stem that often branches near the base. Nocca helianthifolia is part of the Violaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar morphological traits.
